intro: Gaya nutans, commonly known as the hanging gourd, is a flowering plant belonging to the Cucurbitaceae family. It is characterized by its trailing or climbing habit and produces small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant's fruit is a long, cylindrical capsule that turns orange when mature. Native to tropical regions of Asia, it thrives in warm, humid climates. Its botanical features make it a common ornamental and medicinal plant in many parts of the world.
